intro: Audibertia spinulosa, commonly known as the spiny audibertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy, spiny stems. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
